subject: statistics
title: Bayesian Linear Regression
contentHtml:
In Bayesian linear regression, we model the relationship between a dependent variable and one or more independent variables using Bayes' theorem.

We start by specifying a prior distribution over the coefficients of our linear model. This prior reflects our initial uncertainty about the relationships between the variables.
intuition: The key insight is that by incorporating prior knowledge, we can regularize our model and avoid overfitting.
realWorldApplications: Predicting user engagement in online platforms

subject: statistics
title: Bayesian Linear Regression
contentHtml:
In Bayesian linear regression, we model the relationship between a dependent variable and one or more independent variables using a probabilistic approach.

We place a prior distribution on the coefficients of the linear model, which allows us to incorporate our prior knowledge about the relationships between the variables.
intuition: The key insight is that by placing a prior on the coefficients, we can regularize our model and avoid overfitting.
visualDescription: A diagram showing the linear relationship between the independent variables and the dependent variable, with the prior distribution represented as a cloud around the true values.
commonMistakes: Failing to account for uncertainty in the model
realWorldApplications: Predicting user engagement based on features like time of day and device type
